section_1_text.eng:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the ‚ÄúSupport Contacts‚Äù section in your Library for help.

rows.section_1_text:
This module includes content that may be sensitive. You can check it out by yourself first. This will prepare you well for sharing the content with your teen and others afterwards.

If you need support, see the ‚ÄúSupport Contacts‚Äù section in your Library for help.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today‚Äôs topic is dealing with crises.

All families face crises. When we prepare together and know where to get help before something happens, we can handle it more calmly and confidently.

Crises can be scary, but you can get through them together.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today‚Äôs topic is dealing with crises.

All families face crises. When we prepare together and know where to get help before something happens, we can handle it more calmly and confidently.

Crises can be scary, but you can get through them together.

media_title.eng: Can skills to handle crises help your family? Tap play to find out

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is dealing with crises.

Crisis may occur anywhere. Crisis may occur anytime. Therefore, it is important as a family to have plans in place should any family member find themselves in a crisis situation.

It is important to have plans so that every family member may feel protected.

When we are dealing with crises, remember to take a pause, breathe and keep yourself calm. That will help you to deal with crises better.

rows.media_title: Can skills to handle crises help your family? Tap play to find out
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is dealing with crises.

Crisis may occur anywhere. Crisis may occur anytime. Therefore, it is important as a family to have plans in place should any family member find themselves in a crisis situation.

It is important to have plans so that every family member may feel protected.

When we are dealing with crises, remember to take a pause, breathe and keep yourself calm. That will help you to deal with crises better.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Every crisis is a challenge, but it is also a chance to grow stronger as a family and show your teen that together, you can get through anything.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Every crisis is a challenge, but it is also a chance to grow stronger as a family and show your teen that together, you can get through anything.

media_title.eng: @data.characters.media_female_9.name and her teen learned to handle crises together. Hear their story

media_transcript.eng:
My teen used to be so angry all the time. He would never listen and we would get into big arguments every day. Through @global.app_name, I started spending more time with my teen and strengthening our relationship. One day he shared with me that he was part of a gang but he wanted to get out.

We made short-term and long-term plans together on how we could do that. Our life looks so different now!

rows.media_title: @data.characters.media_female_9.name and her teen learned to handle crises together. Hear their story
rows.media_transcript:
My teen used to be so angry all the time. He would never listen and we would get into big arguments every day. Through @global.app_name, I started spending more time with my teen and strengthening our relationship. One day he shared with me that he was part of a gang but he wanted to get out.

We made short-term and long-term plans together on how we could do that. Our life looks so different now!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Crisis can happen to anyone.

Let's see what happened with @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Crisis can happen to anyone.

Let's see what happened with @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name and her granddaughter, @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name:

character_1_text.eng: Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?

rows.character_1_text: Shame my dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?
It‚Äôs that man, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ he touched me.

character_1_text.eng: It‚Äôs that man, he‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ he touched me.

character_2_text.eng: (ü§î_thinking_) Oh no, this is terrible! Let me take a deep breath‚Ä¶ Now, what does my child need? She needs me to be calm and listen.

character_3_text.eng: Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I am listening.

rows.character_2_text: (ü§î_thinking_) Oh no, this is terrible! Let me take a deep breath‚Ä¶ Now, what does my child need? She needs me to be calm and listen.
rows.character_3_text: Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, I am listening.

rows.character_1_text: Yesterday when you went to see your friend. He just came and that‚Äôs when it happened. He‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ he made me have sex with him! I did not want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.

character_1_text.eng: Yesterday when you went to see your friend. He just came and that‚Äôs when it happened. He‚Ä¶ he‚Ä¶ he made me have sex with him! I did not want to, I swear, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.

character_2_text.eng: Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault.

rows.character_2_text: Thank you for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault.

rows.character_1_text: Let‚Äôs decide together what to do. Your @data.characters.f2_grandfather_role.name loves you and he would want to help. Are you okay with it if I call him?

character_1_text.eng: Let‚Äôs decide together what to do. Your @data.characters.f2_grandfather_role.name loves you and he would want to help. Are you okay with it if I call him?

rows.character_1_text: I am so sorry this happened to you, my child. We are here to support you. What you shared is important. We will find a way to get the help we need.

character_1_text.eng: I am so sorry this happened to you, my child. We are here to support you. What you shared is important. We will find a way to get the help we need.

rows.character_1_text: I think it would be a good idea to go to the clinic, so they can do a check-up to make sure you are okay. What do you think about that?

character_1_text.eng: I think it would be a good idea to go to the clinic, so they can do a check-up to make sure you are okay. What do you think about that?

character_2_text.eng: Yes‚Ä¶ Okay‚Ä¶ But will you come with me @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name?

character_3_text.eng: Of course I will. And @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name? Remember this is not your fault. I love you. You are a good person. We will get through this.

rows.character_2_text: Yes‚Ä¶ Okay‚Ä¶ But will you come with me @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name?
rows.character_3_text: Of course I will. And @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name? Remember this is not your fault. I love you. You are a good person. We will get through this.

rows.character_1_text: I am glad we could handle this together. I was so scared you would think this is my fault.

character_1_text.eng: I am glad we could handle this together. I was so scared you would think this is my fault.

character_2_text.eng: Of course not. A crisis can happen to any family. It is important that @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name trusts us and we can support her. We can also look online at what support and information is available to help us.

rows.character_2_text: Of course not. A crisis can happen to any family. It is important that @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name trusts us and we can support her. We can also look online at what support and information is available to help us.

Let's think about how @data.characters.f2_grandmother.name supported @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name through this crisis.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think. 

Here are some tips to help you deal with a crisis!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Crisis can make us feel angry or helpless. But this is when our teens really need us to breathe, listen and think. 

Here are some tips to help you deal with a crisis!

section_1_text.eng: Make sure your teen knows they can talk to you about anything that happens online and offline, and if a crisis happens, you will handle it together.

section_2_text.eng: Stay calm. Ask yourself, "What does my teen need right now?"

section_3_text.eng: Tell them you are there for them and love them.

section_4_text.eng: Talk with your teen. What might help the situation? Reach out to the available support around you, in your community, and online.

section_4_extra_text.eng: You might need to make immediate plans now and then long-term plans later. Remember, you can find Support Contacts in the @global.app_name Library.

rows.section_1_text: Make sure your teen knows they can talk to you about anything that happens online and offline, and if a crisis happens, you will handle it together.
rows.section_2_text: Stay calm. Ask yourself, "What does my teen need right now?"
rows.section_3_text: Tell them you are there for them and love them.
rows.section_4_text: Talk with your teen. What might help the situation? Reach out to the available support around you, in your community, and online.
rows.section_4_extra_text: You might need to make immediate plans now and then long-term plans later. Remember, you can find Support Contacts in the @global.app_name Library.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
It is helpful to practise dealing with crises before something happens.

Let's look at five family crisis examples together. Imagine you are the parent: What would you do?

Remember: CONNECT - BREATHE - LISTEN - THINK

text_1_facilitator.eng:
It is helpful to practise dealing with crises before something happens.

Let's look at five family crisis examples together. Imagine you are the parent: What would you do?

Remember: CONNECT - BREATHE - LISTEN - THINK

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Crisis 1: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name gets pregnant.

How could you respond to @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name?

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Crisis 1: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name gets pregnant.

How could you respond to @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name?

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f1_father_role.name, I am so ashamed. I do not know what to do.

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f1_father_role.name, I am so ashamed. I do not know what to do.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Crisis 2: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name makes a girl pregnant.

How could you respond to @data.characters.f1_son_18.name?

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Crisis 2: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name makes a girl pregnant.

How could you respond to @data.characters.f1_son_18.name?

character_1_text.eng: I do not want to have a baby.

rows.character_1_text: I do not want to have a baby.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Crisis 3: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name shares a nude picture of his friend at school.

How could you respond to @data.characters.f2_son_15.name?

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Crisis 3: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name shares a nude picture of his friend at school.

How could you respond to @data.characters.f2_son_15.name?

character_1_text.eng: I have never done this before. And now they will expel me.

rows.character_1_text: I have never done this before. And now they will expel me.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Crisis 4: Someone in the family may get sick.

How could you respond in this situation?

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Crisis 4: Someone in the family may get sick.

How could you respond in this situation?

character_1_text.eng: The test said I have HIV. I am scared I am going to die.

rows.character_1_text: The test said I have HIV. I am scared I am going to die.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Crisis 5: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name is pressured into sex by her boyfriend.

How could you respond to @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name?

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Crisis 5: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name is pressured into sex by her boyfriend.

How could you respond to @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name?

character_1_text.eng: I didn't really want to. Now I will get pregnant or be ill. @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name, I am so scared...

rows.character_1_text: I didn't really want to. Now I will get pregnant or be ill. @data.characters.f2_grandmother_role.name, I am so scared...

rows.text_1_facilitator: This week's home activity is to look back at the five crisis examples and discuss what you would do together if this happened to a friend or in your family.

text_1_facilitator.eng: This week's home activity is to look back at the five crisis examples and discuss what you would do together if this happened to a friend or in your family.

text_2.eng:
**Choose one example to discuss with your teen:** 

- Crisis 1: @data.characters.f2_son_15.name fights at school
- Crisis 2: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name gets pregnant
- Crisis 3: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name makes a girl pregnant
- Crisis 4: Someone in the family may get sick
- Crisis 5: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name is pressured into sex by her boyfriend


**And remember:**
üòå BREATHE: Stay calm 
üëÇüèæ LISTEN: Assure your teen you are there for them
üí≠ THINK: What might help this situation?

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you chat with your teen about how you could respond to a crisis together?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's wonderful! Talking about this now will help your teen feel supported and safe. You are doing great.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Give it a try! It can feel hard, but even just thinking about it and starting the conversation together is already a big step.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's completely okay - talking about potential crises can feel overwhelming. Keep spending time with your teen, and come back to this when it feels right.

- Crisis 2: @data.characters.f1_daughter_16.name gets pregnant
- Crisis 3: @data.characters.f1_son_18.name makes a girl pregnant
- Crisis 4: Someone in the family may get sick
- Crisis 5: @data.characters.f2_daughter_19.name is pressured into sex by her boyfriend


**And remember:**
üòå BREATHE: Stay calm

rows.quiz_1_question: Can you chat with your teen about how you could respond to a crisis together?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's wonderful! Talking about this now will help your teen feel supported and safe. You are doing great.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Give it a try! It can feel hard, but even just thinking about it and starting the conversation together is already a big step.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: That's completely okay - talking about potential crises can feel overwhelming. Keep spending time with your teen, and come back to this when it feels right.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Remember to support and encourage each other. It is hard to remain calm and listen to each other in a crisis - you can be proud of yourself.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Remember to support and encourage each other. It is hard to remain calm and listen to each other in a crisis - you can be proud of yourself.

media_title.eng: @data.characters.media_daughter_12.name overcame a difficult crisis with the help of her mother. Tap play to learn how

media_transcript.eng:
Two years ago, I was raped by my uncle who stayed in our yard. I did not tell my mother, because I was afraid she would hit me, shout at me, or even throw me out of the house. I did not have anywhere else to go.

When my mother started with @global.app_name, we started spending more time together. I was still afraid, but in the end I shared it with my mother. My mom did not shout, but she listened and told me it is not my fault. We went to the police and the clinic together. I am so grateful I do not have to carry this secret anymore.

rows.media_title: @data.characters.media_daughter_12.name overcame a difficult crisis with the help of her mother. Tap play to learn how
rows.media_transcript:
Two years ago, I was raped by my uncle who stayed in our yard. I did not tell my mother, because I was afraid she would hit me, shout at me, or even throw me out of the house. I did not have anywhere else to go.

When my mother started with @global.app_name, we started spending more time together. I was still afraid, but in the end I shared it with my mother. My mom did not shout, but she listened and told me it is not my fault. We went to the police and the clinic together. I am so grateful I do not have to carry this secret anymore.
